Key Match Events: Orlando Arcia hit two home runs in the Braves' 7-2 win over the Phillies.
Reynaldo López allowed one run over six innings, continuing his strong performance since coming off the injured list.
Braves starting pitchers haven't allowed more than three runs in 19 straight games, the club's longest single-season streak since 1893.
Post-Match Reflections: Braves manager Brian Snitker emphasized the importance of winning every game in their current situation.
Orlando Arcia expressed happiness and gratitude for his recent performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves have hit 26 home runs over their past 18 games.
The Braves are within five games of the first-place Phillies in the National League East and have a three-game lead in the battle for the NL’s final Wild Card spot.
